node.title: SA's COVID hospitalisation rate remains steady as state records 1,953 new cases
node.alt: COVID-19 vaccination rollout at Elizabeth in Adelaide's northern suburbs.
node.description: South Australia records 1,953 COVID cases in the past 24 hours – 448 fewer than yesterday.
node.content:
["South Australia has recorded 1,953 COVID cases in the past 24 hours \u2013 448 fewer than yesterday.", "Premier Steven Marshall said the figure was\u00a0significantly below the state's seven-day average.", "He described the figures as preliminary and said he did not have information about whether there had\u00a0been any deaths.", "There has been no change to the number of people in hospital with COVID-19, which\u00a0remains at 288.", "One more person has been admitted to intensive care bringing the number to 27.", "There are now five people on ventilators, an increase of one person since yesterday.", "The Premier said while he did not have the numbers on how many people had recovered, he expected it had increased, as\u00a0per previous days.", "\"I expect it to be a continuation of where we've been in recent days with more people recovering than\u00a0are becoming newly infected,\" he said.", "\"[It's] another sign that we are at or now past that peak here in South Australia.\"", "A relaxation of\u00a0working from home recommendations\u00a0has come into effect today, and the Premier said it would help give struggling businesses a\u00a0boost.", "\"We are gradually, in a staged way, improving the number of people in the CBD,\" he said.", "\"We're particularly encouraging them to get out, spend some money \u2026 we're very keen to see some increased activity.", "\"We're the first in Australia to make this move. Our primary responsibility is to all South Australians and I think this is a good first step.", "\"We want to do it in a safe way and we're strongly advising people to wear masks.\"", "More to come.", "", "
I've had COVID, can I get it again?
"]
